''Trust in politics' However, Labour said David Cameron could not escape responsibility for bringing Mr Andy Coulson into his top team when there were unresolved questions about his past. I think that David Cameron was wrong to appoint someone to the heart of the government, to the heart of Downing Street, who had actually been editor of a newspaper at a time when criminal activity was going on, Ms Harriet Harman said. While acknowledging that Mr Andy Coulson had denied any involvement in phone hacking, she added the issue risked further eroding public confidence in politics.
